questions.stem: When should compound adjectives be hyphenated?

options.label: When they appear before the noun they modify
When they appear after the noun they modify
Never, they should always be separate words

questions.rationale: Compound adjectives are typically hyphenated when they appear before the noun they modify (well-known author) but not when they appear after (the author is well known).

Compound adjectives before nouns should be hyphenated

questions.rationale: Don't hyphenate adverbs ending in -ly, but do hyphenate compound adjectives before nouns.

questions.stem: Which prefix always requires a hyphen?
questions.rationale: The prefix 'self-' always requires a hyphen: self-control, self-service, self-evident.

questions.stem: Complete these prefix combinations: __________ (against Canada), __________ (former president), __________ (before MBA), __________ (personal control)
questions.rationale: Hyphens are used before proper nouns, with 'ex-' meaning former, before capitals, and always with 'self-'.

questions.rationale: Self- always takes a hyphen, while co- usually doesn't need one in modern usage.

questions.stem: Which suffix combination requires a hyphen?
questions.rationale: The suffix '-elect' requires a hyphen: president-elect, governor-elect.

questions.stem: What is the basic principle for word division?

options.label: Divide words anywhere to fit the line
Divide between syllables following dictionary breaks
Never divide words under any circumstances

questions.rationale: Words should be divided between syllables according to dictionary syllable breaks.

questions.stem: How should ages be written when used as adjectives?
questions.rationale: Ages used as adjectives should be fully hyphenated: 30-year-old minister.
